text:
Bucklin is a city in Ford County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 794 people lived there.
History.
Bucklin was originally called Corbitt. It was planned out in 1885. It was renamed Bucklin in 1887. It was named after Bucklin Township.
Bucklin was incorporated in 1909. It was at the junction of two railroads.
Geography.
Bucklin is at (37.547942, -99.635001). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. Of that, is land and is water.
Climate.
Bucklin has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Bucklin has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 794 people, 287 households, and 204 families living in Bucklin.
Education.
Bucklin is part of USD 459 Bucklin.
